[{'created': '2018-06-25 15:08:28.000000000', 'message': "Switch bifrost jobs to nonvoting

bifrost doesn't have a symmetrical gate with ironic, which means
sometimes it can get broken by ironic changes. It's important that we
don't break bifrost, but sometimes it can break us, so let's change it

Change-Id: I69a6c4b05cfeebb31721c9787241161a080da045
"}]
commit_message:
Switch bifrost jobs to nonvoting

bifrost doesn't have a symmetrical gate with ironic, which means
sometimes it can get broken by ironic changes. It's important that we
don't break bifrost, but sometimes it can break us, so let's change it
to non-voting and pay attention to it.

Change-Id: I69a6c4b05cfeebb31721c9787241161a080da045

commit_message:
Fix the None value of Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE if enable neutron-*

Currently, the devstack installs neutron with 2 ways, one uses
neutron-legacy, the other uses new-neutron-configure way. So they use
different variables. This patch fixes the 'Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE' which
from neutron-legacy part.

Change-Id: I303711ba166ece4e6f51b712284c69a0fb342e25

commit_message:
Switch to oslo_messaging.ConfFixture.transport_url

oslo_messaging's rpc_backend setting, which is set by
ConfFixture.transport_driver has been deprecated since Newton. To allow
oslo_messaging to remove it, switch to setting transport_url instead.

Change-Id: Ideded5eff79425a813062cfb341ae8c005030544
Partial-Bug: #1712399

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-30 21:56:40.000000000', 'message': 'Metadata-API fails to retrieve avz for instances created before Pike

In Pike (through change: I8d426f2635232ffc4b510548a905794ca88d7f99)
we started setting instance.avilability_zone during schedule time by
calculating the avz of the host into which the instance was scheduled
into. After this change was introduced, the metadata request for the avz
on the instance (through change: I73c3b10e52ab4cfda9dacc0c0ba92d1fcb60bcc9)
started using instance.get(availability_zone) instead of doing the upcall.
However this would return None for instances older than Pike whose
availability_zone was not mentioned during boot time as it would be set to
CONF.default_schedule_zone whose default value is None.

This patch adds an online_migration tool to populate missing
instance.availability_zone values.

Conflicts:
      nova/cmd/manage.py
      nova/tests/functional/db/test_instance.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to the following changes which
were added in Queens:

  I6db4eb46df0d7ec025b969a46621823957503958

  I5b4b235b88367c361d38371d430d67ff583a906c

  I4b33751b6793f60c6f2703c379c36387c49d866d

Change-Id: I2a1d81bfeb1ea006c16d8f403e045e9acedcbe57
Closes-Bug: #1768876
(cherry picked from commit 6b4c38c04177ff194d05368cd4aff69958075167)
(cherry picked from commit 0a481a52929626c5fab8fd6fd50cca6882db3bd9)

commit_message:
Metadata-API fails to retrieve avz for instances created before Pike

In Pike (through change: I8d426f2635232ffc4b510548a905794ca88d7f99)
we started setting instance.avilability_zone during schedule time by
calculating the avz of the host into which the instance was scheduled
into. After this change was introduced, the metadata request for the avz
on the instance (through change: I73c3b10e52ab4cfda9dacc0c0ba92d1fcb60bcc9)
started using instance.get(availability_zone) instead of doing the upcall.
However this would return None for instances older than Pike whose
availability_zone was not mentioned during boot time as it would be set to
CONF.default_schedule_zone whose default value is None.

This patch adds an online_migration tool to populate missing
instance.availability_zone values.

Conflicts:
      nova/cmd/manage.py
      nova/tests/functional/db/test_instance.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to the following changes which
were added in Queens:

  I6db4eb46df0d7ec025b969a46621823957503958

  I5b4b235b88367c361d38371d430d67ff583a906c

  I4b33751b6793f60c6f2703c379c36387c49d866d

Change-Id: I2a1d81bfeb1ea006c16d8f403e045e9acedcbe57
Closes-Bug: #1768876
(cherry picked from commit 6b4c38c04177ff194d05368cd4aff69958075167)
(cherry picked from commit 0a481a52929626c5fab8fd6fd50cca6882db3bd9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-20 07:47:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: sphinx-docs job for stable branch and pep8 issues

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Pep8 job is broken due to recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding
pycodestyle update.

This commit fixes the following errors:
  - E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
  - W503 line break before binary operator
  - E402 module level import not at top of file

Change-Id: I55879d70f05de60a423176e5bf1803758f27c691
(cherry picked from commit 753bb7bbaf8176c3349259e8f0d6f7bb19d77bcd)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: sphinx-docs job for stable branch and pep8 issues

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Pep8 job is broken due to recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding
pycodestyle update.

This commit fixes the following errors:
  - E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
  - W503 line break before binary operator
  - E402 module level import not at top of file

Change-Id: I55879d70f05de60a423176e5bf1803758f27c691
(cherry picked from commit 753bb7bbaf8176c3349259e8f0d6f7bb19d77bcd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 21:28:01.000000000', 'message': "Automatically append reset_color to log lines

It's confusing that log colors can persist across multiple log lines
if they are not explicitly reset at the end of each line.  This
change automatically appends the reset escape sequence to the end of
each log record passed through the ColorHandler so the behavior is
more what most people would expect.

Change-Id: I5fefdbdd7dd2ca437863bf2117b5a93b527e9776
"}]
commit_message:
Automatically append reset_color to log lines

It's confusing that log colors can persist across multiple log lines
if they are not explicitly reset at the end of each line.  This
change automatically appends the reset escape sequence to the end of
each log record passed through the ColorHandler so the behavior is
more what most people would expect.

Change-Id: I5fefdbdd7dd2ca437863bf2117b5a93b527e9776

I think I've figured out the cause of the bool->string casting, and it's due to using DictOfStringsField:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515423/28/nova/objects/migrate_data.py@41

I don't know why this wasn't a problem in earlier runs of the live migration job, but I think there are bound to be a lot more cases like this, so rather than play whack-a-mole I'm just going to store vif_details and profile as serialized json blobs similar to BlockDeviceMapping.connection_info which is totally dependent on the volume type, similar to how vif_details is dependent on the vif type."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-25 16:19:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Should be fixed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515423/ now.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 23:36:40.000000000', 'message': 'Handle strings as booleans in nova.network.model.VIF utils

The is_hybrid_plug_enabled and is_neutron_filtering_enabled
methods are used in _nova_to_osvif_vif_ovs to determine
if we should have a VIFBridge object or a VIFOpenVSwitch
object. The values in the vif details dict-o-doom are neutron
backend driver dependent, and not validated via schema, so
we could get strings instead of booleans and since:

  if "False":
      ...

equates to True, we can end up getting the wrong type of
os-vif object which can cause vif plugging to fail.

This uses the strutils.bool_from_string utility to convert
strings (if there are strings) to booleans.

Change-Id: I53223da95da61440d0f9b1cd02bf9e8e5ccde818
'}, {'created': '2018-06-20 12:21:22.000000000', 'message': 'Handle strings as booleans in nova.network.model.VIF utils

equates to True, we can end up getting the wrong type of

commit_message:
Handle strings as booleans in nova.network.model.VIF utils

The is_hybrid_plug_enabled and is_neutron_filtering_enabled
methods are used in _nova_to_osvif_vif_ovs to determine
if we should have a VIFBridge object or a VIFOpenVSwitch
object. The values in the vif details dict-o-doom are neutron
backend driver dependent, and not validated via schema, so
we could get strings instead of booleans and since:

  if "False":
      ...

equates to True, we can end up getting the wrong type of
os-vif object which can cause vif plugging to fail.

This uses the strutils.bool_from_string utility to convert
strings (if there are strings) to booleans.

Change-Id: I53223da95da61440d0f9b1cd02bf9e8e5ccde818

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 00:23:16.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Icbd5b9ce255ae57b75fd58335b6c4d1df36f49ae
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Icbd5b9ce255ae57b75fd58335b6c4d1df36f49ae

commit_message:
Add required packages to build mysql-python

The horizon deploys are failing due to missing packages required to
install the mysql-python pip package. This PR adds those in.

Depends-On: I3df2c670beeb78baaa1515bcd27e8f2b0d95b3a9
Change-Id: I20abe34118014f9bca03daadf5d1f14b7f9fd0ff

Thank you. Removing +2 till you complete your investigation.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-05-28 18:40:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-05-28 18:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Implemented version where referenced /Settings object is loaded dynamically. The same pattern is used in System for Processor and Ethernet Interfaces.
Because this is re-usable field the referenced object also is built dynamically. Sample JSON does not give any hint about the type of reference object, but based on BIOS samples I made an assumption that it is the same as parent resource. Thus passing resource to constructor to know what type of instance to create, and to use its connection to fetch the /Settings resource. If this assumption is wrong, then in future when more precise information is available this can be refactored.

Another related change, introduced idRefField in common module. This used to be SettingsObjectField in previous version, but taking closer look it is not tied to Settings, but can be used in other cases too.

Will investigate Zuul failure.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-05-29 08:19:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Implemented version where referenced /Settings object is loaded
 > dynamically. The same pattern is used in System for Processor and
 > Ethernet Interfaces.
 > Because this is re-usable field the referenced object also is built
 > dynamically. Sample JSON does not give any hint about the type of
 > reference object, but based on BIOS samples I made an assumption
 > that it is the same as parent resource. Thus passing resource to
 > constructor to know what type of instance to create, and to use its
 > connection to fetch the /Settings resource. If this assumption is
 > wrong, then in future when more precise information is available
 > this can be refactored.
 > 
 > Another related change, introduced idRefField in common module.
 > This used to be SettingsObjectField in previous version, but taking
 > closer look it is not tied to Settings, but can be used in other
 > cases too.
 > 
 > Will investigate Zuul failure.

Zuul dsvm failed due to broken CI, not related to these changes.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-05-30 15:39:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Oh, this is a complex schema, good job figuring it out! It took me quite some time to go through all examples.

So, now we're going to have

 system.bios().settings_object()

right? Do you think we can hide the settings_object inside of Settings? So that Settings class handles PUT actions for us?"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-05-30 15:44:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Correction:

 system.bios.settings().settings_object

What I suggest is hiding the last bit, so that we can do something like 

 system.bios.settings().attributes

to get attributes and something like 

 system.bios.settings().set_attributes({'Name': 'Value'})

to send PUT to settings_object."}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-05-30 16:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Correction:
 > 
 > system.bios.settings().settings_object
 > 
 > What I suggest is hiding the last bit, so that we can do something
 > like
 > 
 > system.bios.settings().attributes
 > 
 > to get attributes and something like
 > 
 > system.bios.settings().set_attributes({'Name': 'Value'})
 > 
 > to send PUT to settings_object.

yes, I think it will be possible to hide the settings_object level and handle attribute update. 
The only thing, the /Settings sub-resource contains 3 other fields besides attributes: Id, Name, and AttributeRegistery.
Do we need to expose/move one level up these fields too? They look only descriptive and maybe sushy users don't need to know them.
Sample values from BIOS/Settings:

    "Id": "Settings",
    "Name": "BIOS Configuration Pending Settings",
    "AttributeRegistry": "BiosAttributeRegistryP89.v1_0_0"'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-05-30 16:18:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yep, I don't think these are really useful."}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-05-31 08:45:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-05-31 08:48:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

changes made: 

exposed `attributes` at `SettingsField` level so that can use settings().attributes and bios.settings.attributes = {'Name': 'Value'}

I'm using PATCH to update attributes to allow partial updates.

To support this made other changes and simplified structure. As now we are only processing and exposing 'Attributes' created a `SettingsResource` that only holds attributes.
Don't pass parent resource to constructor of SettingsFields anymore, and don't instantiate generic Settings resource dynamically. Replaced it by passing connection and redfish_version only and instantiating SettingsResource. 

Adjusted existing tests and added new tests for setting attributes."}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-05-31 09:52:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-05 14:47:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

I came across Mockup readme that gave 2 more examples where Settings are used: NIC and Storage. 
I found a sample of NIC with Settings[1] where "Attributes" are not present - that structure is BIOS specific.
I did not find a sample for Storage that has @Redfish.Settings but I will double check this. 

I will revisit the proposed solution and update.

[1] https://redfish.dmtf.org/redfish/mockups/v1/863#Managers--BMC--NICs--Dedicated'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-05 18:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-05 18:30:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Reverted the changes to previous version. 
Updated commit message to reflect recent findings. 
Rebased. 

I will be looking at implementing suggested set_attributes approach in BIOS patch.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-06 09:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(5 comments)

Oh, why is Redfish so overcomplicated? :(

Good catch. Some more suggestions inline.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-06 19:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-06 19:38:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(5 comments)

thanks for feedback, see inline comments. 

I got rid of dynamic loading of settings_object as parent resource will take care of that. Now the proposed solution is close to the one originally proposed in patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28128, 'date': '2018-06-06 19:47:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)

A couple of Redfish comments for the commit message...'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-07 09:15:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-07 09:20:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

thanks, commit message updated, see inline for details.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-07 09:21:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Rebased, commit message updated.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-06-14 13:22:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(16 comments)

Thank you, looks good! A handful of minor suggestions enclosed. ;-)'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-15 12:14:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-15 12:15:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(16 comments)

thanks, see updates inline.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-18 09:34:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

This is shaping really well. Two more things inline to make the API a bit more robust.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-18 16:52:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-18 17:07:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Hid _etag.
Nice idea about set_settings, added with tests.

Regarding ETag in patching, my understanding is that here ETag comes from owner resource, not this field. The ETag returned in this field is just informational for apply settings results to tell the version these apply results correspond to (so maybe not hide it?). 
ETag for collision checking should come from owner resource - @odata.etag field or response header ETag.
According to spec[1][2] ETags appear to be recommended, not mandatory (the spec uses 'should') and could depend on each system's implementation, that's why I have made it optional, passing it will be up to owner (e.g., BIOS resource). 
There is no @odata.etag in Redfish samples, and headers are not part of samples; also I couldn't find an existing usecase in sushy that handles ETags.

[1] http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/DSP0266_1.5.0.html#etags
[2] http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/DSP0266_1.5.0.html#etag-property"}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-18 18:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-06-18 18:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-06-18 19:34:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(4 comments)

thanks, see inline comments'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-06-20 13:08:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-21 19:22:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-21 19:28:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-21 19:32:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

As requested this is now merged together with dependent patch introducing BIOS to make it easier to review. 

In this patchset updates are made to BIOS part, which is commented in the original patch [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570890/'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-22 07:55:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-06-22 14:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Thank you! This looks quite fishy already!'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-25 08:02:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2018-06-25 08:03:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(5 comments)

thanks, see inline comments.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-06-25 14:18:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-25 14:35:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

I think it's a great start, thanks. Left one comment inline, I suspect we may want to hide one of the attributes (in a follow up patch). Let's now think how to expose success/failure :)"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-25 10:34:48.000000000', 'message': 'Adds Settings field

SettingsField is a reusable field that corresponds to
@Redfish.Settings in other resources.
For now I have only identified it to be used in BIOS resource that
will be added in dependent patch.

This SettingsField corresponds to v.1.0.0., newer versions
introduce additional fields that will be added later. Also at least
iDRAC does not support anything newer than v.1.0.0 now.

For testing in settings.json I improvise with values for Message,
Severity, MessageArgs and Resolution fields as could not find existing
samples holding these fields.

Another thing to note that @Redfish.Settings do not appear as part
of BIOS schema, but it is visible in the samples of BIOS resource.

Change-Id: Ib2ef3d6380975ec7b964ebb634575e2b86d51991
Task: #19767
Story: #2001791

in BIOS, EthernetInterface nor Storage schema, but it is visible in
the samples of BIOS and EthernetInterface resources.

Change-Id: Ib2ef3d6380975ec7b964ebb634575e2b86d51991
Task: #19767
Story: #2001791
'}, {'created': '2018-06-15 12:14:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add Settings field

SettingsField is a reusable field that corresponds to
@Redfish.Settings in other resources.

This SettingsField corresponds to Settings.v1_0_0 field schema, newer
versions introduce additional fields that will be added later.
Also at least iDRAC does not support anything newer than
Settings.v1_0_0 field schema now.

In the unit tests, settings.json contains imaginary values for Message,
Severity, MessageArgs and Resolution fields as could not find existing
samples holding these fields.

@Redfish.Settings is a special field (annotation) that does not appear
as a property in any schemas of Redfish resources.
Theoretically it can be present in any resource.
Practically this field is added to resources that support future state
of the resource where immediate application of updates is not possible
and need to restart system or a service for the values to take effect.
So far it has been identified that resources that can have this field
are: BIOS, Ethernet Interface and Storage.

Change-Id: Ib2ef3d6380975ec7b964ebb634575e2b86d51991

present on the resource, then can update the resource directly using
the resource's URI.

commit_message:
Introduce BIOS API

Add `system` resource to have reference to `bios`.

Support patching via @Redfish.Settings settings object resource
using new SettingsField.

SettingsField is a reusable field that corresponds to
@Redfish.Settings in other resources.

This SettingsField corresponds to Settings.v1_0_0 field schema, newer
versions introduce additional fields that will be added later.
Also at least iDRAC does not support anything newer than
Settings.v1_0_0 field schema now.

In the unit tests, settings.json contains imaginary values for Message,
Severity, MessageArgs and Resolution fields as could not find existing
samples holding these fields.

@Redfish.Settings is a special field (annotation) that does not appear
as a property in any schemas of Redfish resources.
Theoretically it can be present in any resource.
Practically this field is added to resources that support future state
of the resource where immediate application of updates is not possible
and need to restart system or a service for the values to take effect.
So far it has been identified that resources that can have this field
are: BIOS, Ethernet Interface and Storage.
If @Redfish.Settings is present on the resource, then need to use URI
in its subfield SettingsObject to update resource. If it is not
present on the resource, then can update the resource directly using
the resource's URI.

Change-Id: Ib2ef3d6380975ec7b964ebb634575e2b86d51991
Task: 12508
Story: 2001791

commit_message:
add --task-per option to import-goal

Using --task-per repo results in one task for every repository. The
default is --task-per project which gives one task for each project.

Change-Id: I2dc3b85ce4fd866436ac7d2d924392c80d9de142
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

add configuration option to disable certificate verification

the storyboard-dev.openstack.org server doesn't have a valid cert (at
least according to requests) so we need to be able to disable
certificate validation

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

In order to make easy orchestration on all OpenStack db-sync, add this
tag so people can use this tag in composition layer.
A use case it to set some orchestration to make sure MySQL Galera is
ready before running any Exec with this tag.

Change-Id: I800fd9a00ddf7e7ca0ebd54c9d203cf04477aa3b
Closes-Bug: #1755102
(cherry picked from commit d595457836a82a20b18573b085b166d396bdba1a)

commit_message:
Add 'openstack-db' tag to db-sync Exec resource

In order to make easy orchestration on all OpenStack db-sync, add this
tag so people can use this tag in composition layer.
A use case it to set some orchestration to make sure MySQL Galera is
ready before running any Exec with this tag.

Change-Id: I800fd9a00ddf7e7ca0ebd54c9d203cf04477aa3b
Closes-Bug: #1755102

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ide9493cf06b7af03324d46d673047b8ada354e5e
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2018-06-22 00:39:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix setting of physical_host_addrs

For 'physical_host_addrs' to be able to be looked up by the connection
plugin it will need to be included in the 'task_vars' dictionary which
is eventually passed to the task executor.

Change-Id: I16bc76f17ae5d2da4803fd7cdcdcfe72e77f9df1
"}, {'created': '2018-06-22 07:57:26.000000000', 'message': "Fix setting of physical_host_addrs

For 'physical_host_addrs' to be able to be looked up by the connection
plugin it will need to be included in the 'task_vars' dictionary which
is eventually passed to the task executor. Moreover, we remove the now
obsoleted[1] 'set_host_overrides' function and also check whether a task
is delegated on the container itself so we do not try to ssh to it.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/23b1dbacaf8a20f7147de0f67f8d6c67de2142ef
Co-Authored-By: Markos Chandras <mchandras@suse.de>
Change-Id: I16bc76f17ae5d2da4803fd7cdcdcfe72e77f9df1
"}, {'created': '2018-06-22 08:22:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix setting of physical_host_addrs

For 'physical_host_addrs' to be able to be looked up by the connection
plugin it will need to be included in the 'task_vars' dictionary which
is eventually passed to the task executor. Moreover, we remove the now
obsoleted[1] 'set_host_overrides' function and also use the 'host'
attribute to determine if the host that executes the task is the same
as the physical_host and decide whether we are going to connect to a
container or not.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/23b1dbacaf8a20f7147de0f67f8d6c67de2142ef
Co-Authored-By: Markos Chandras <mchandras@suse.de>
Change-Id: I16bc76f17ae5d2da4803fd7cdcdcfe72e77f9df1
"}, {'created': '2018-06-22 08:50:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix setting of physical_host_addrs

For 'physical_host_addrs' to be able to be looked up by the connection
plugin it will need to be included in the 'task_vars' dictionary which
is eventually passed to the task executor. Moreover, we remove the now
obsoleted[1] 'set_host_overrides' function.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/23b1dbacaf8a20f7147de0f67f8d6c67de2142ef
Co-Authored-By: Markos Chandras <mchandras@suse.de>
Change-Id: I16bc76f17ae5d2da4803fd7cdcdcfe72e77f9df1
"}, {'created': '2018-06-22 14:44:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix setting of physical_host_addrs

For 'physical_host_addrs' to be able to be looked up by the connection
plugin it will need to be included in the 'task_vars' dictionary which
is eventually passed to the task executor. Moreover, we remove the now
obsoleted[1] 'set_host_overrides' function.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/23b1dbacaf8a20f7147de0f67f8d6c67de2142ef
Co-Authored-By: Markos Chandras <mchandras@suse.de>
Change-Id: I16bc76f17ae5d2da4803fd7cdcdcfe72e77f9df1
"}, {'created': '2018-06-22 23:59:20.000000000', 'message': "Fix connection plugin for Ansible 2.5

For 'physical_host_addrs' to be able to be looked up by the connection
plugin it will need to be included in the 'task_vars' dictionary which
is eventually passed to the task executor. Moreover, we remove the now
obsoleted[1] 'set_host_overrides' function.

If the 'container_name' variable is available, it should take precedence
over 'inventory_hostname' for determining a container's name.

The 'container_user' variable is now set through 'set_options' instead
of a host variable and, when it is available, the connection plugin's
shell is initialized with a system writable temp directory to avoid
requiring additional privileges for the user.

The container check has been updated to also check 'container_name'
against 'ansible_host'. If these match, the container is only known by
an IP address and will require a direct SSH connection.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/23b1dbacaf8a20f7147de0f67f8d6c67de2142ef
Co-Authored-By: Markos Chandras <mchandras@suse.de>
Change-Id: I16bc76f17ae5d2da4803fd7cdcdcfe72e77f9df1
"}, {'created': '2018-06-23 00:05:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix connection plugin for Ansible 2.5

For 'physical_host_addrs' to be able to be looked up by the connection
plugin it will need to be included in the 'task_vars' dictionary which
is eventually passed to the task executor. Moreover, we remove the now
obsoleted[1] 'set_host_overrides' function.

If the 'container_name' variable is available, it should take precedence
over 'inventory_hostname' for determining a container's name.

The 'container_user' variable is now set through 'set_options' instead
of a host variable and, when it is available, the connection plugin's
shell is initialized with a system writable temp directory to avoid
requiring additional privileges for the user.

The container check has been updated to also check 'container_name'
against 'ansible_host'. If these match, the container is only known by
an IP address and will require a direct SSH connection.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/23b1dbacaf8a20f7147de0f67f8d6c67de2142ef
Co-Authored-By: Markos Chandras <mchandras@suse.de>
Change-Id: I16bc76f17ae5d2da4803fd7cdcdcfe72e77f9df1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix connection plugin for Ansible 2.5

For 'physical_host_addrs' to be able to be looked up by the connection
plugin it will need to be included in the 'task_vars' dictionary which
is eventually passed to the task executor. Moreover, we remove the now
obsoleted[1] 'set_host_overrides' function.

If the 'container_name' variable is available, it should take precedence
over 'inventory_hostname' for determining a container's name.

The 'container_user' variable is now set through 'set_options' instead
of a host variable and, when it is available, the connection plugin's
shell is initialized with a system writable temp directory to avoid
requiring additional privileges for the user.

The container check has been updated to also check 'container_name'
against 'ansible_host'. If these match, the container is only known by
an IP address and will require a direct SSH connection.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/23b1dbacaf8a20f7147de0f67f8d6c67de2142ef
Co-Authored-By: Markos Chandras <mchandras@suse.de>
Change-Id: I16bc76f17ae5d2da4803fd7cdcdcfe72e77f9df1

commit_message:
Add 'openstack-db' tag to db-sync Exec resource

In order to make easy orchestration on all OpenStack db-sync, add this
tag so people can use this tag in composition layer.
A use case it to set some orchestration to make sure MySQL Galera is
ready before running any Exec with this tag.

Change-Id: Ic1de9ab495c83ae3300c5597dfa527d3b7ab7168
Closes-Bug: #1755102
(cherry picked from commit ff2403fd22f698bf5e80294faab94c5cb8502b5d)

Change BootSourceOverrideMode from BIOS to Legacy

Because this is what DMTF schema [1] requires.

1. https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/ComputerSystem.v1_5_0.json

Co-Authored-By: Richard G. Pioso <richard.pioso@dell.com>
Story: 2002635
Task: 22277

messages:
[{'account_id': 6287, 'date': '2017-06-05 16:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-05 17:37:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-networking-generic-switch-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/51/471051/1/check/gate-networking-generic-switch-docs-ubuntu-xenial/8682dc0//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 49s
- gate-networking-generic-switch-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/51/471051/1/check/gate-networking-generic-switch-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/ca80e69/ : SUCCESS in 8m 21s
- gate-networking-generic-switch-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/51/471051/1/check/gate-networking-generic-switch-python27-ubuntu-xenial/11c2e3b/ : SUCCESS in 5m 39s
- gate-networking-generic-switch-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/51/471051/1/check/gate-networking-generic-switch-python35/b1eb86a/ : SUCCESS in 3m 20s
- gate-networking-generic-switch-dsvm-tempest http://logs.openstack.org/51/471051/1/check/gate-networking-generic-switch-dsvm-tempest/0363617/ : SUCCESS in 16m 13s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipa-wholedisk-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa-multinode-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/51/471051/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipa-wholedisk-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa-multinode-ubuntu-xenial/610c331/ : SUCCESS in 57m 13s'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-06-06 17:51:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

David, to actually be able to use this, you'd have to register an entry-point in setup.cfg, with the name of entry-point 'netmiko_<netmiko device>', with <netmiko device> being one of those recognized by netmiko library [0]

NGS relies on netmiko for SSH-based configuration of switches as it abstracts for us all the grunt preparation work of opening connection, parsing command prompts and setting elevation.

Currently I see there only support for 'hp_procurve' and 'hp_comware'. Which one is your switch? Choose one of supported and name the class more distinct instead of simply 'Hp'.

[0] https://github.com/ktbyers/netmiko/blob/5b5463fb01e39e771be553281748477a48c7391c/netmiko/ssh_dispatcher.py#L46"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-06-13 21:24:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-06-13 21:47:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-06-14 06:15:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 19307, 'date': '2018-06-14 06:40:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-14 09:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-25 13:19:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Looks sensible. Not adding +A as dtantsur was talking about releasing NGS soon.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-25 13:20:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow+1

The 1.1.0 release is done, but we'll have another one in the Rocky cycle, I believe."}]

commit_message:
support hpe device type for the HPE 5900 series switches

To enable vlan configuration of HPE 5900 series switches that use
comware5 netconf.

Change-Id: I5a5a60f3e5af1ec9e23609fe491345f10daee110

[{'created': '2018-06-11 16:20:18.000000000', 'message': "Ensure resource class cache when listing usages

In rare circumstances it is possible to list usages in a new placement
process that has not yet instantiated the _RC_CACHE but for which
there are inventories and allocations in the database (added by
other processes running against the same db). Before this change
that would cause a 500 error (AttributeError) when the Usage objects
in the UsageList were instantiated.

The fix is to added _ensure_rc_cache to the two list methods. The
addition is done there rather than in the _from_db_object as the
latter would cause a lot of redundant checks.

While we could probably devise a test for this, it's perhaps good
enough to evaluate the change by inspection. If not, suggestions
welcome.

Change-Id: I00f7dee26f031366dbc0d3d6a03abe89afeb85fd
Closes-Bug: #1775308
(cherry picked from commit 724d440122232a5bfdfec51eb0d37ca4f1d748d8)
(cherry picked from commit 79a1a113775df87d420b242cea4bbf953df3779c)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure resource class cache when listing usages

In rare circumstances it is possible to list usages in a new placement
process that has not yet instantiated the _RC_CACHE but for which
there are inventories and allocations in the database (added by
other processes running against the same db). Before this change
that would cause a 500 error (AttributeError) when the Usage objects
in the UsageList were instantiated.

The fix is to added _ensure_rc_cache to the two list methods. The
addition is done there rather than in the _from_db_object as the
latter would cause a lot of redundant checks.

While we could probably devise a test for this, it's perhaps good
enough to evaluate the change by inspection. If not, suggestions
welcome.

Change-Id: I00f7dee26f031366dbc0d3d6a03abe89afeb85fd
Closes-Bug: #1775308
(cherry picked from commit 724d440122232a5bfdfec51eb0d37ca4f1d748d8)
(cherry picked from commit 79a1a113775df87d420b242cea4bbf953df3779c)

commit_message:
Switch to providing created_at field for servers

All of the current models return the creation date in created_at
with the exception of servers which are currently returned with
a created field instead.

This patch addresses this and gives the ability to get access to
both.

Change-Id: Ifbd59834080eea62dead19d18a9a11a851a4ce2e

commit_message:
Add CentOS extras repository inside containers

There are a few useful and important packages which are provided
by the `extras` repository that are needed by things like Percona
for example libuv.

There is no reported issues in terms of compatibility between the
extras repositories and RDO.  As a matter of fact, CentOS release
packages are all located in there so you can't get started with
the cloud SIG packages without it anyways.

In addition, we'll be storing the repo information in a specific
file in order to avoid having to do the shell-out and manually
changing attributes in a weird way.

Change-Id: I3df2c670beeb78baaa1515bcd27e8f2b0d95b3a9

commit_message:
Remove volume client and usage in scenario tests

We don't need the volume/Cinder client in our scenario
tests, nor the methods that it was currently being
used in. Remove its usage from the base class to
unblock https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

Change-Id: I111c648280912fcbad671cc27cf87c496e8689ba
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

commit_message:
Consolidate member role to standard

With the latest change to keystone regarding default roles, this
change moves all instances of the member role to be set as
"member", from any deviations in casing or characters.

Change-Id: I9f49fb562239047763c88fcb09a13d891b80d60a

commit_message:
includes options defined in kafka common

The generated sample config did not include common kafka options
specified in kafka_common.py.
This was resolved by appending these options along with options
unique to the kafka metric-topic/alarm-topic

Change-Id: I3d765e9bdef0cfac186ebb9bddd97a7336076794
story: 2002649
task: 22355

commit_message:
Gate: fix dns port collision

This PS updates the dnsmasq pod that runs in the gate to allow vm's
API access to only bind to br-ex, as otherwise it collides with other
DNS servers running in the gates.

Change-Id: I85bb3043d56689ad8ee2996df61d23969a535de1

commit_message:
Add Elasticsearch image with s3 repository plugin

This introduces an image that extends the elasticsearch:5.6.4
image to include the s3 repository plugin, allowing us to use the
s3 api for radosgw to support elasticsearch's snapshot repository
functionality

Change-Id: I9cd4a4442ace48ea8615dd57da3ebc744956ca64

Set a group_var for undercloud nodes that configures the remote tmp file
for Ansible to use $HOME from the environment. This worked unintentionally in
Ansible < 2.5.4 and was changed in
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/36755.

commit_message:
Set ANSIBLE_REMOTE_TMP for undercloud group

Set a group_var for undercloud nodes that configures the remote tmp file
for Ansible to use $HOME from the environment. This worked unintentionally in
Ansible < 2.5.4 and was changed in
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/36755.

Setting this explicitly using the recommended variable to ensure this works
reliably.

Related Ansible issue: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/41808

Change-Id: I21a99a579fcc25f37d1f1d9d6b98bd7b5bf3a35a

commit_message:
Fix conductor manager unit tests

This fixes some of the conductor-manager's unit tests; mostly the
cleaning-related ones. Some of the mocking was incorrect (e.g.
mocked calls), because 'autospec=True' was not specified.

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Conflicts:
	tox.ini

Change-Id: I984feb279774895efbe587b962afeda882c55e65
(cherry picked from commit 5ebee30934fb086c69adc52d0643e913d00311e1)

messages: [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-06-25 09:56:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-06-25 13:32:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-25 09:56:32.000000000', 'message': 'Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

The following is not the part of the stable cherry-pick:
Also fixes the lower-constraints file to allow the CI to pass.

Change-Id: I7d61303c145784c86d95ccc5cd58f4ced376a713
(cherry picked from commit fc012cb706540c5f72709ebdc4d284021c8e3141)
'}]
commit_message:
Gate fix: Cap hacking to avoid gate failure

hacking is not capped in g-r and it is in
blacklist for requirement as hacking new version
can break the gate jobs.

Hacking can break gate jobs because of various
reasons:
- There might be new rule addition in hacking
- Some rules becomes default from non-default
- Updates in pycodestyle etc

That was the main reason it was not added in g-r
auto sync also. Most of the project maintained the
compatible and cap the hacking version in
test-requirements.txt and update to new version when
project is ready. Bumping new version might need code
fix also on project side depends on what new in that
version.

If project does not have cap the hacking version then,
there is possibility of gate failure whenever new hacking
version is released by QA team.

Example of such failure in recent release of hacking 1.1.0
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130282.html

The following is not the part of the stable cherry-pick:
Also fixes the lower-constraints file to allow the CI to pass.

Change-Id: I7d61303c145784c86d95ccc5cd58f4ced376a713
(cherry picked from commit fc012cb706540c5f72709ebdc4d284021c8e3141)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-20 19:40:31.000000000', 'message': "Be graceful about vif plugging in early ironic driver startup

During ironic driver startup, we re-plug VIFs (for potentially
dubious reasons). If we're racing with ironic startup, which is
likely on single-node (i.e. undercloud) installations, we will
attempt to do the plug and can fail because no ironic conductors
are available to do the job. It sounds like ironic should be
returning 500 in this case, and maybe the long-term solution is
to do that and have ironicclient manage the retry for us.

For the moment, ironic shows its hand in the message, indicating
the conductor reasoning. This patch makes us retry for up to a
minute waiting for that to clear, before actually failing.

Change-Id: I6450ceb54bd85945b76d3ac46882e1fea6b82742
Related-Bug: #1777475
(cherry picked from commit 07f027d2b068caa1ebde81e476ce01f55a0fa5b1)

commit_message:
Be graceful about vif plugging in early ironic driver startup

During ironic driver startup, we re-plug VIFs (for potentially
dubious reasons). If we're racing with ironic startup, which is
likely on single-node (i.e. undercloud) installations, we will
attempt to do the plug and can fail because no ironic conductors
are available to do the job. It sounds like ironic should be
returning 500 in this case, and maybe the long-term solution is
to do that and have ironicclient manage the retry for us.

For the moment, ironic shows its hand in the message, indicating
the conductor reasoning. This patch makes us retry for up to a
minute waiting for that to clear, before actually failing.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Test conflict due to _get_cached_node being
introduced in Rocky by Id96e7e513f469b87992ddae1431cce714e91ed16.

Change-Id: I6450ceb54bd85945b76d3ac46882e1fea6b82742
Related-Bug: #1777475
(cherry picked from commit 07f027d2b068caa1ebde81e476ce01f55a0fa5b1)

commit_message:
Remove the ilo classic drivers

This removes pxe_ilo, iscsi_ilo and agent_ilo. Also removed is
the whole documentation section dedicated to them.

Change-Id: Ie6f8a65d68ce4eb9c8467c416df5f3a35f0abe98

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to transition plan [1],
we should have py36 testenv ready for it.

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition

Change-Id: I41723a6fed6946af11dc5c639f2529e8c12972be

commit_message:
Bump setuptool to 39.2.0

There has been some reported issues with installation of some
packages with the current pinned release so hopefully getting
up on a newer one will resolve some of those issues.

Change-Id: I187b0d5e1d8f3fd0fd03da5c50d17a9463d5dc4b

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2017-06-19 15:27:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I think I'm missing something here. At the controller/handlers/vif.py, should it loop to call request_vif as many times as the networks annotated? I only see one call to request_vif.

Also, should the constants.py be updated from kuryr-vif to kuryr-vifs as described in the multi-vif-pods bp?"}, {'account_id': 15168, 'date': '2017-06-20 04:56:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)

thanks for the review. see replies inline.
as for the loop  I'm not sure what you mean about looping with multiple request_vifs. This commit does not introduce the ability to request multiple vifs, just the ability to pass multiple vifs from controller to the CNI. This is mentioned in the commit message as well. I made this patch this way to allow my SRIOV patches use the mechanism. I believe mechanism to request multiple VIFs should be implemented in a separate patch."}, {'account_id': 15168, 'date': '2017-06-20 05:01:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-20 05:22:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified+1

(6 comments)

You should adapt the patch for CNI daemon, which will (fingers crossed) soon become default way to run Kuryr.

In particular:

* CNIDaemonWatcherService.on_done [1] should now be getting the dictionary with VIFs and save all of it into the registry.
* K8sCNIRegistryPlugin._do_work() [2] should iterate over the VIFs dictionary and be able to return the VIF that should be returned to the CNI.

Those two small changes should be enough to make it work.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/blob/master/kuryr_kubernetes/cni/daemon/service.py#L225-L231

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-05 15:22:27.000000000', 'message': "Allow passing multiple VIFs to CNI

This commit alters the format of the annotation, set and read by
controller/CNI. Instead of a single VIF object it now holds a
dictionary, that maps interface names to VIF objects. Controller
currently only sets 'eth0' as the default VIF. The CNI is altered
accordingly to read VIFs from the mapping and add all of them to Pods
namespace.

This commit does not include any mechanism to actually request multiple
IPs/ports for a Pod, but rather lays foundation for future commits, that
would allow that.

Related bp: kuryr-kubernetes-sriov-support
Targets bp: multi-vif-pods

Change-Id: Iaef928e7ab9dc0fce8b7e8fffb7b5a1f6b5ccb17

"}, {'created': '2017-07-17 11:09:48.000000000', 'message': "Allow passing multiple VIFs to CNI

This commit alters the format of the annotation, set/read by
controller/CNI. Instead of a single VIF object it now holds a
dictionary, that maps interface names to VIF objects. Controller
currently only sets 'eth0' as the default VIF. The CNI is altered
accordingly to read VIFs from the mapping and add all of them to Pods
namespace. It would now wait for all VIFs on the Pod to become active
before calling the callback.

This commit does not include any mechanism to actually request multiple
IPs/ports for a Pod, but rather lays foundation for future commits, that
would allow that.

Related bp: kuryr-kubernetes-sriov-support
Targets bp: multi-vif-pods

commit_message:
Allow passing multiple VIFs to CNI

This commit alters the format of the annotation, set and read by
controller/CNI. Instead of a single VIF object it now holds a
dictionary, that maps interface names to VIF objects. Controller
currently only sets 'eth0' as the default VIF. The CNI is altered
accordingly to read VIFs from the mapping and add all of them to Pods
namespace.

This commit does not include any mechanism to actually request multiple
IPs/ports for a Pod, but rather lays foundation for future commits, that
would allow that.

Related bp: kuryr-kubernetes-sriov-support
Targets bp: multi-vif-pods

Change-Id: Iaef928e7ab9dc0fce8b7e8fffb7b5a1f6b5ccb17

commit_message:
Add Docker support

Add support for running dragonflow as a docker container.

Includes documentation how to set up with OVS running on the host.

Change-Id: Ia7185ea7f9d47a56853def418aeab8c3a4e87d0a
Resolves-Bug: #1778007

subject: Note that tox need python3-dev or python-dev
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 19779, 'name': 'Chason Chan', 'display_name': 'chenxing', 'email': 'chason.chan@foxmail.com', 'username': 'chenxing'}, {'_account_id': 20156, 'name': 'Petr Kovar', 'email': 'pkovar@redhat.com', 'username': 'pmkovar'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2018-06-07 12:01:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2018-06-07 13:01:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

this whole document is all about working with python, i would think the reader knows installing python is a requirement :)

maybe we should add a note early on in the doc instead? and point to https://www.python.org/downloads/ ... just tossing ideas around as i don't think the proposed change helps enough"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-07 13:19:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I really don't think it's necessary in the python guide to point out that you need python."}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2018-06-07 15:34:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I really don't think it's necessary in the python guide to point
 > out that you need python.

As Petr Triaged this bug, I have added him as a reviewer. Let's think about his mind. :D"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-06-12 12:32:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I really don't think it's necessary in the python guide to point
 > out that you need python.

I reckon the issue that is being solved here is not that Python needs to be installed, but rather that python-dev does, which _might_ be less obvious. Not sure."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-12 14:54:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> > I really don't think it's necessary in the python guide to point
 > > out that you need python.
 > 
 > I reckon the issue that is being solved here is not that Python
 > needs to be installed, but rather that python-dev does, which
 > _might_ be less obvious. Not sure.

I also think it *is* useful to help folks figure out what they need if they are not already python developers.

One comment inline about placement, but I like the additional text. We may come up with a list of other packages that would be useful and we can add those to the same note block later."}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2018-06-25 07:40:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-25 12:50:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-06-25 13:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

simple, tidy, ship it!

Thanks'}]

commit_message:
Update os_neutron role SHA for OVS fix

OVS deployments are currently broken due to a missing default
value for neutron_ovs_service_name.

This patch brings the role SHA forward to include [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/568360

Change-Id: Iff8b2927ba524ebf5b00c16d67aae624fdfe318b
Closes-Bug: 1771200

According to the Manila devref you should be able to use the following
pattern:

if req_version.matches("2.1", "2.5"):

Fix this to accept a string, as well as None for object.

commit_message:
Allow api_version_request.matches to accept a string or None

According to the Manila devref you should be able to use the following
pattern:

if req_version.matches("2.1", "2.5"):
    ....stuff....
elif req_version.matches("2.6", "2.10"):
    ....other stuff....
elif req_version > api_version_request.APIVersionRequest("2.10"):
    ....more stuff.....

However, the api_version_request.matches() function will not accept a
string, it requires an api_version_request object.

Fix this to accept a string, as well as None for object.

Change-Id: Ic2faaaa7696cc7a647679cbb7a8600b30c3d66d7
Closes-Bug: 1550337

commit_message:
Fix centos opstools repo deactivation

The repo name and the variable were wrong, with this
fix by default opstool is not installed, not it was installed.
Also looks like the opstool deps breaks tripleo.

Closes-Bug: 1778040

Change-Id: Ibd6cd439ef2c297ed420b96ea40bd71ebcab6fd6

commit_message:

Rather than formatting a string to pass as the exception initialization
it was passing in a tuple of the format string and value. This changes
it to perform the string formatting correctly.

Also fixes up a whitespace issue in one of the other exception strings.

Some time ago we opted against creating a separate package for tests, since it made our packaging simpler. I'm not against starting this for services, but I'd like to hear more opinions.

Besides that, the spec changes look ok to me."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-06-22 10:07:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I wonder why the tests package has a python- prefix. I would have expected python3 as prefix. Could you clarify that?'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-06-22 10:21:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I wonder why the tests package has a python- prefix. I would have
 > expected python3 as prefix. Could you clarify that?

In puppet we use python- prefix to use test packages. Okk since now we have python3- only in rpm-packaging spec, so i will rename test packages to python3- and add virtual provides for python- to have it supported by puppet deployments.'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-06-22 11:39:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-06-22 13:30:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-06-25 12:15:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-06-25 12:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Create tests package for keystone and glance

Exclude tests from python package, instead create
a new subpackage to ship tests for keystone and glance.

Also Fix:
[keystone] username:- %{keystone} --> keystone
[glance] api package dependency on base package

Change-Id: I65d8e5de9f524ed09aa306a8ab82d3117c1b6e27

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-19 16:37:06.000000000', 'message': "Be graceful about vif plugging in early ironic driver startup

During ironic driver startup, we re-plug VIFs (for potentially
dubious reasons). If we're racing with ironic startup, which is
likely on single-node (i.e. undercloud) installations, we will
attempt to do the plug and can fail because no ironic conductors
are available to do the job. It sounds like ironic should be
returning 500 in this case, and maybe the long-term solution is
to do that and have ironicclient manage the retry for us.

For the moment, ironic shows its hand in the message, indicating
the conductor reasoning. This patch makes us retry for up to a
minute waiting for that to clear, before actually failing.

Change-Id: I6450ceb54bd85945b76d3ac46882e1fea6b82742
Related-Bug: #1777475
"}, {'created': '2018-06-20 07:27:19.000000000', 'message': "Be graceful about vif plugging in early ironic driver startup

During ironic driver startup, we re-plug VIFs (for potentially
dubious reasons). If we're racing with ironic startup, which is
likely on single-node (i.e. undercloud) installations, we will
attempt to do the plug and can fail because no ironic conductors
are available to do the job. It sounds like ironic should be
returning 500 in this case, and maybe the long-term solution is
to do that and have ironicclient manage the retry for us.

For the moment, ironic shows its hand in the message, indicating
the conductor reasoning. This patch makes us retry for up to a
minute waiting for that to clear, before actually failing.

Change-Id: I6450ceb54bd85945b76d3ac46882e1fea6b82742
Related-Bug: #1777475
"}]
commit_message:
Be graceful about vif plugging in early ironic driver startup

During ironic driver startup, we re-plug VIFs (for potentially
dubious reasons). If we're racing with ironic startup, which is
likely on single-node (i.e. undercloud) installations, we will
attempt to do the plug and can fail because no ironic conductors
are available to do the job. It sounds like ironic should be
returning 500 in this case, and maybe the long-term solution is
to do that and have ironicclient manage the retry for us.

For the moment, ironic shows its hand in the message, indicating
the conductor reasoning. This patch makes us retry for up to a
minute waiting for that to clear, before actually failing.

Change-Id: I6450ceb54bd85945b76d3ac46882e1fea6b82742
Related-Bug: #1777475

Once that merges, this patch will need to be updated to include that commit's hash for the validation to pass."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-06-21 16:29:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Release xstatic-angular-material 1.1.5.1

1.1.5.1 keeps consistency with angular-material
official release and provides static files missing
in 1.1.5.0.
Matches to angular-material 1.1.5

Change-Id: I717733001aa508241b9c6fb41f9df7ff69403e65

[{'created': '2018-06-18 16:00:48.000000000', 'message': 'Import Zuul setting from project-config

All projects are moving their Zuul configs from the
openstack-infra/project-config repo to their local repos. Once this change
has been backported to all open stable branches, we can remove the
centralised config.

translation-jobs-queens is omitted because we will set that up on the
stable/queens branch specifically (in place of translation-jobs, which runs
only on master).

Change-Id: Ia182e4dcf1a0b8e3af124b6676b20e6adb55f76b
'}]
commit_message:
Import Zuul setting from project-config

All projects are moving their Zuul configs from the
openstack-infra/project-config repo to their local repos. Once this change
has been backported to all open stable branches, we can remove the
centralised config.

translation-jobs-queens is omitted because we will set that up on the
stable/queens branch specifically (in place of translation-jobs, which runs
only on master).

Change-Id: Ia182e4dcf1a0b8e3af124b6676b20e6adb55f76b

commit_message:
Enable Swift multinode grenade testing

As Swift is aiming to add multinode grenade rolling upgrade test. The
goal here is to disable specific services on primary
and/or subnode and test compatibility.

This introduces a new features.yaml element that would
disable s-proxy on primary node. This will be required for Swift
multinode grenade jobs that will test compatibility
of master s-account, s-container, s-object
with stable s-proxy.

Also in devstack-gate-vm.sh the storage node needs to be
identified for configuration.  In this case that node is
the primary node.

Change-Id: I4681518b0142da1d43c1d090e30a3e7ec696d2b9

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-06 19:18:51.000000000', 'message': "Use testr from system python

The testrepository python package is always system installed, it's how
we collect subunit data from all runs in the cleanup functions. So
instead of assuming it's present in a tox venv from tempest, which it
isn't always because of one use case where it's using system site
pacakges, just call the system version.

Change-Id: I5d07b49c5b428b1c92d990e7cc822a3483d39689
"}, {'created': '2017-03-07 00:08:47.000000000', 'message': "Reintroduce testr slowest after tempest run

This commit reintroduces the testr slowest call after the tempest run to
print the slowest tests from the job. This was recently reverted in
change Ibde5417d005265d27e939ca29788c21f73b38980 because of an issue
when running tempest with system site packages enabled where the testr
binary wasn't in the venv. This is because the testrepository python
package is always system installed, and it's how we collect subunit data
from all runs in the cleanup functions. So now instead of assuming it's
present in a tox venv from tempest, it just calls the system version.

Change-Id: I5d07b49c5b428b1c92d990e7cc822a3483d39689
"}]
commit_message:
Reintroduce testr slowest after tempest run

This commit reintroduces the testr slowest call after the tempest run to
print the slowest tests from the job. This was recently reverted in
change Ibde5417d005265d27e939ca29788c21f73b38980 because of an issue
when running tempest with system site packages enabled where the testr
binary wasn't in the venv. This is because the testrepository python
package is always system installed, and it's how we collect subunit data
from all runs in the cleanup functions. So now instead of assuming it's
present in a tox venv from tempest, it just calls the system version.

Change-Id: I5d07b49c5b428b1c92d990e7cc822a3483d39689

commit_message:
Adding Permission for stack users to access images

Recently in a grenade job in networking-odl some
tempest tests [1] were failing because of not having
permission to access images. This patch will add
permissions for stack group users to access those
images.

[1]. http://logs.openstack.org/43/425843/2/check/gate-grenade-dsvm-networking-odl-nv/51dfb82/testr_results.html.gz
Change-Id: I5f0046ccd80f1b0109b32d8a27c1977ad7f241cb

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-02-17 20:09:52.000000000', 'message': "Create baremetal flavor and sets it in tempest's bm section

Ironic started to use devstack plugin. That caused a bug cause there was
no away to run stack phases on the ironic plugin before tempest cause
tempest is in-tree service right now, and thus tempest stop honoring the
DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE=baremetal set on ironic jobs.

This change aims, along w/ I3bdf46afc4c67433cd66bee7aed278f51b544941, in
tempest, and I7bd7e34bb182ecc3edc4d334b84f75f673d9814c, in ironic, to fix
that by moving the baremetal flavor creation into lib/tempest (which makes
sense since it's a resource that tempest uses, not ironic) and introducing
a new option in tempest: baremetal.instance_type (similar idea already
exists for heat).

Change-Id: I59b72e0acb745c86302eca4d770e4c9140c09ee1
Partial-bug: #1546706
Depends-on: I5edc51c7fc8b6f0bb7fe4ca129596709a32eb93e

commit_message:
Create baremetal flavor and sets it in tempest's bm section

Ironic started to use devstack plugin. That caused a bug cause there was
no away to run stack phases on the ironic plugin before tempest cause
tempest is in-tree service right now, and thus tempest stop honoring the
DEFAULT_INSTANCE_TYPE=baremetal set on ironic jobs.

This change aims, along w/ I3bdf46afc4c67433cd66bee7aed278f51b544941, in
tempest, and I7bd7e34bb182ecc3edc4d334b84f75f673d9814c, in ironic, to fix
that by moving the baremetal flavor creation into lib/tempest (which makes
sense since it's a resource that tempest uses, not ironic) and introducing
a new option in tempest: baremetal.instance_type (similar idea already
exists for heat).

Change-Id: I59b72e0acb745c86302eca4d770e4c9140c09ee1
Partial-bug: #1546706
Depends-on: I5edc51c7fc8b6f0bb7fe4ca129596709a32eb93e

commit_message:
Add commands listed in DEVSTACK_GATE_ADD_TEMPEST_SUDO to tempest sudoers

This makes it possible to add sudo permission for commands listed
by DEVSTACK_GATE_ADD_TEMPEST_SUDO environment variables.
The command list should be specified by a comma separator.
For example it will be like the following:
  DEVSTACK_GATE_ADD_TEMPEST_SUDO="/usr/bin/ovs-vsctl,/usr/bin/docker"

Change-Id: I15eddbe468dd43f3b90d1474c4eb27f2ab9e98c3

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-02 09:46:27.000000000', 'message': 'Allow single or multiple spaces in sedding neutron's policy file

In neutron's policy file, the "'context_is_admin':  'role:admin'" rule
has tow spaces after the ':' and there usually is a single space.

There is no problem if the we don't modify the policy file. However,
new oslo policy aims to maintain policy in code, and there is only a
space after the ':' in the policy file genarated by oslo policy, which
will cause tests failure of most neutron gate. Therefore, we should
make sure the sed rule can replace the policy including only one space.

Change-Id: I279b09d0178edb54bb9b988b179754e75ed87361
'}]
commit_message:
Allow single or multiple spaces in sedding neutron's policy file

In neutron's policy file, the "'context_is_admin':  'role:admin'" rule
has tow spaces after the ':' and there usually is a single space.

There is no problem if the we don't modify the policy file. However,
new oslo policy aims to maintain policy in code, and there is only a
space after the ':' in the policy file genarated by oslo policy, which
will cause tests failure of most neutron gate. Therefore, we should
make sure the sed rule can replace the policy including only one space.

Change-Id: I279b09d0178edb54bb9b988b179754e75ed87361

commit_message:
Require that service tokens have the service role

The intent of the X-Service-Token inter-service communications is that
only a service account such as nova, cinder etc should be submitting the
service token. To do this we have to validate that the token that is
transmitted should have the service role.

Change-Id: Ia35c262f59a61fd6405533fe17cda154c9c4073d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-25 18:21:56.000000000', 'message': "Improve error reporting for missing nested template

When the template for a TemplateResource was missing from the files dict
and not otherwise available, we provided misleading feedback when
validating the parent template.

First, we log that we are fetching the template from a URL, even though we
would not actually attempt to do so if it is a file:/// URL. Move the log
to after the allowed scheme check, and log debug to indicate when we cannot
find a template file.

While an exception would be generated in
TemplateResource._generate_schema() at resource initialisation time, it is
suppressed and saved for later. An empty template is used to generate the
properties schema. The exception is re-raised when validate() is called,
but during a template validation we only call validate_template(), not
validate(), so the first error we run into will be a mismatch of property
names. (If no property values were passed in the parent template, we may
not even get an error even though we won't be able to create a stack from
the given data.) Also re-raise the stored exception at the beginning of
validate_template() so that users will see the true source of the error.

Change-Id: I1bc100684e1b84fc9ac54ef523d798b317e4dc51
Related-Bug: #1739447
"}, {'created': '2018-01-27 02:40:24.000000000', 'message': "Improve error reporting for missing nested template

commit_message:
Improve error reporting for missing nested template

When the template for a TemplateResource was missing from the files dict
and not otherwise available, we provided misleading feedback when
validating the parent template.

First, we log that we are fetching the template from a URL, even though we
would not actually attempt to do so if it is a file:/// URL. Move the log
to after the allowed scheme check, and log debug to indicate when we cannot
find a template file.

While an exception would be generated in
TemplateResource._generate_schema() at resource initialisation time, it is
suppressed and saved for later. An empty template is used to generate the
properties schema. The exception is re-raised when validate() is called,
but during a template validation we only call validate_template(), not
validate(), so the first error we run into will be a mismatch of property
names. (If no property values were passed in the parent template, we may
not even get an error even though we won't be able to create a stack from
the given data.) Also re-raise the stored exception at the beginning of
validate_template() so that users will see the true source of the error.

Change-Id: I1bc100684e1b84fc9ac54ef523d798b317e4dc51
Story: #1739447
Task: 22219

commit_message:
test_mount_unmount cleanup

mock assert_has_calls is checking the entire integrity of the call
path, it's ok to just do that call path check once at the end. This
unrolls this test as an example for more clarity.

Change-Id: I89a25c23e7b9e20d711e8c7d56d54365f1bae388

commit_message:
WIP: demonstrate no use of external locking

This is a poisoned fixture that would trigger if we actually tried to
take an external lock, and the lack of failure means we don't go down
this path.

Change-Id: I7a0c724e6da3055d9e3465657c18416f1a177ca1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-26 13:06:18.000000000', 'message': "Remove REQUIRES_LOCKING as nothing needs process locking in the tests

It's unclear why any of our code currently believes it actually needs
process locking between tests, especially as annotating external
locking to be poisoned doesn't ever seem to touch that code. Remove
this confusion from our test suites.

Change-Id: Ic261518d1a8e11686c7026b4ea61e81af2c914cc
"}]
commit_message:
Remove REQUIRES_LOCKING as nothing needs process locking in the tests

It's unclear why any of our code currently believes it actually needs
process locking between tests, especially as annotating external
locking to be poisoned doesn't ever seem to touch that code. Remove
this confusion from our test suites.

Change-Id: Ic261518d1a8e11686c7026b4ea61e81af2c914cc

messages:

- gate-openstackdocstheme-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/91/490991/1/check/gate-openstackdocstheme-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/39db9c8/ : SUCCESS in 3m 26s
- gate-openstackdocstheme-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/91/490991/1/check/gate-openstackdocstheme-docs-ubuntu-xenial/6ebf27c//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 26s

The local TOC is no longer shifted all the way to the left, and each individual step in the indentation is now much bigger. Compare the demo page in the docs job here with https://docs.openstack.org/openstackdocstheme/latest/demo/index.html to see what I mean.

Is that what you were after? Which page are you trying to fix?'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2017-08-14 17:43:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think looking back at some other TOC alignment patches, others may need to look. This is what was done most recently: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/487103/ with the TOC... let us know what you're looking for. Right now, having "Glossary" twice but not at the same indentation makes me a little nutty :) let us know what you're seeking.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2018-06-25 10:37:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-04 17:17:09.000000000', 'message': "Tweak css for sidebar

Because of the way ul elements stack up on each other, the indentation
for 2nd level topics in the TOC were really 40px in. This is a lot of
real estate to take up for this, especially with long titles.

To reset this back to 20, we also need to unwind some css hacking
going on in the local-table-of-contents, otherwise it completely
looses it's margin. The ul:first-of-type isn't really the right pseudo
class here, as that's not about nesting but about linear order. And
what we really need to do is get rid of the outer padding but leave it
for 2 level and down.

Change-Id: I0faf6bf19824a6be31c7eed08b23cc417932958a
"}]
commit_message:
Tweak css for sidebar

Because of the way ul elements stack up on each other, the indentation
for 2nd level topics in the TOC were really 40px in. This is a lot of
real estate to take up for this, especially with long titles.

To reset this back to 20, we also need to unwind some css hacking
going on in the local-table-of-contents, otherwise it completely
looses it's margin. The ul:first-of-type isn't really the right pseudo
class here, as that's not about nesting but about linear order. And
what we really need to do is get rid of the outer padding but leave it
for 2 level and down.

Change-Id: I0faf6bf19824a6be31c7eed08b23cc417932958a

This really isn't going to work in future devstack iterations, so
remove it so that dependency on it doesn't sneak back into swift

Needs a swiftclient change before this can land to not break swift.

Change-Id: Ide58670b193f1df6f41836f908018c786fef1d7e
Depends-On: Ie427f3b0b9eb834ff940fa5d52444a5a6cdcab15

commit_message:
remove old auth_host / auth_port

This really isn't going to work in future devstack iterations, so
remove it so that dependency on it doesn't sneak back into swift
functional tests.

Needs a swiftclient change before this can land to not break swift.

Change-Id: Ide58670b193f1df6f41836f908018c786fef1d7e
Depends-On: Ie427f3b0b9eb834ff940fa5d52444a5a6cdcab15

commit_message:
Allow swift functional tests to use keystone auth uri

Devstack is working through changes to drop the special ports on
things like keystone, as such everything is going to need to
understand and work with keystone auth_uri. This change allows the
swift functional tests to consume the auth_uri directly.

Change-Id: Ie427f3b0b9eb834ff940fa5d52444a5a6cdcab15

commit_message:
add regression test for bug #1538011

This builds a test using a real mysql db (with the mysql opportunistic
bits from oslo.db), then spawns the API layer on top of it.

It then replicates the aggregates fail scenario of setting metadata
abc=1 followed by ABC=2. On mysql this triggers a 500 error due to
text string matching in a case insensitive way.

Note: this currently fails, will need the fix at the same time to land
this patch.

Related-Bug: #1538011

Change-Id: Ic09327ff3485477b1b22d1f15e0c3dd962011361

commit_message:
Configure [neutron] in nova_cell*.conf

The nova-conductor service running in the cell
needs to be configured to talk to neutron for
things like deallocating networks during server
build failure. This changes the configure_neutron_nova
flows such that the top-level nova.conf is configured
as before, but we also configure each nova_cell*.conf
cell conductor config files to also be able to talk
to neutron.

Change-Id: Ic5e17298996b5fb085272425bb3b68583247aa34
Closes-Bug: #1777505

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 19:13:59.000000000', 'message': 'ha-guide: fix incorrect statement about innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit

It looks like there was a typo for the values of innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit

Per http://galeracluster.com/documentation-webpages/configuration.html

Note Warning: While setting innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit to a value of 0 or 2
improves performance, it also introduces certain dangers. Operating system
crashes or power outages can erase the last second of transaction. Although
normally you can recover this data from another node, it can still be lost
entirely in the event that the cluster goes down at the same time, (for
instance, in the event of a data center power outage).

Change-Id: I09d0e0be4c85e6bd5469a35482a6392491168298
